title: Why doesn't anyone Declare their champion?
body: It's one of the best and least used features of champ select >.<

Anyways, the reason I personally don't declare my champion is because of how frequently people will then ban that champion or take them before me just to spite me for whatever reason. Idk, I just love Karma too much to take the risk :p
Because I get trolls who see me playing something, usually perfectly meta and they ban it with the intention of irritating me.
I don't ever go into a game knowing what I am going to play.

Sometimes, I don't know what I'm going to play up until it's my turn to pick. I do use pick intent, but mostly just to dick around. If I am serious about pick intent, I just use it to hover champs I'm considering.
Because if I call Shen they'll automatically assume Shen top, even though Shen top is garbage tier right now until he gets those buffs.

I always declare if I'm mid because I only really play Ahri. I want to make sure my team doesn't ban it on me.

I almost never declare if I'm top lane until I know what I'm going to play. Which basically means I'll only declare before my pick if the enemy top laner picks. Sometimes I would hover my options (try to subtly tell the team I may go Quinn so that 3 adc strategy so far really sucks for me) but that never seemed to work. It seems most players don't care about team comp - they want to play what they want to play. It's unfortunate, because I get counterpicked top lane often. When I do get the chance to counterpick I'd like to use it...
I don't because normally I'm support and need to fill in whatever position my team isn't fulling.  No tank, guess I'll play Braum/Naut/Thresh.  All AD team, support Brand it is.
people will always ban it. or pick something you don't want them to pick that "goes with it"
People either ban out pick intents, or prefer waiting for enemy to pick first.

Because my pick depends on both enemy picks and how my team is looking in ad/ap/tankage. 

Too many people declaring and sticking to it regardless of pick order is how you get full ad teams.
Also if somebody ends up dodging the queue, the enemy team could do a target ban (obviously pending ELOs).
